refnamediv.refpurpose: Binary safe optionally case insensitive comparison of 2 strings from an offset, up to length characters

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: substr_compare compares main_str from position offset with str up to length characters.

Returns < 0 if main_str from position offset is less than str, > 0 if it is greater than str, and 0 if they are equal. If length is equal or greater than length of main_str and length is set, substr_compare prints warning and returns &false;.
If case_sensitivity is &true;, comparison is case sensitive.

example.title: A substr_compare example
example.programlisting: <?php echo substr_compare("abcde", "bc", 1, 2); // 0 echo substr_compare("abcde", "bcg", 1, 2); // 0 echo substr_compare("abcde", "BC", 1, 2, true); // 0 echo substr_compare("abcde", "bc", 1, 3); // 1 echo substr_compare("abcde", "cd", 1, 2); // -1 echo substr_compare("abcde", "abc", 5, 1); // warning ?>
